intro: Entolasia stricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved entolasia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Entolasia stricta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
